name: Marid Noble
movement: walk 30 ft., fly 60 ft., swim 90 ft.
description: The Marid Noble is a grand elemental resembling a large, aquatic humanoid with intricate water-themed features, commanding a majestic presence.
memorable: Its ability to control water and unleash powerful spells makes it a commanding presence in any aquatic environment.
goals: Typically seeks to dominate its environment and assert its authority over water and aquatic creatures.
relations: May be encountered with water elementals or other beings of elemental influence.
environment: Aquatic and aerial settings, often in regions with abundant water.
strengths: High hit points, strong melee and ranged attacks with its trident, and versatile spellcasting abilities.
weaknesses: Vulnerable to certain magical effects despite resistances to acid, cold, and lightning damage.
attacks: Can perform multiattacks with its trident for piercing and lightning damage, and can use nets to restrain foes.
most_powerful_ability: The Water Jet attack can deal significant bludgeoning damage and knock opponents prone.
senses: Has blindsight out to 30 feet, allowing it to detect creatures without needing to see them.
skills: Excels in perception and persuasion, indicating high awareness and social influence.
additional_information: Can breathe both air and water.
Innate spellcasting allows it to cast spells without material components.
Has a Fog Cloud ability for battlefield control.
Trident magically returns when thrown, enhancing its utility.
Can unleash a powerful Water Jet when bloodied.
spellcasting: Can cast various spells including 'alter self' and 'control water', with innate casting ability based on Charisma.
test_queries: large elemental creature dominant in water
